channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration.

item.title: Report E-2025060289
item.description:
Report E-2025060289

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-16
  • City: COUSHATTA
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A specification cargo tank 1,000 gallons or greater containing any hazardous materials that (1) received structural damage to the lading retention system or damage that requires repair to a system int
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RC FREIGHT LINES, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Incident Report: Transportation Package Failure and Release Response Sequence of Events Leading to the Incident: On the morning of June 16, 2025, at 8:26 AM, Driver Carnest Nutall contacted dispatch to report that he had run his truck and trailer off the road and into a ditch at the curve where County Road 174 intersects Bob Wilson Road, while traveling northbound. The unit involved was Truck RC-34 pulling Trailer 107, both loaded with chemical product identified under BOL 1150607. The material being transported was M2Guard-HSR105G, manufactured by Foremark Performance for M2 Chemical. The driver was approximately 15 minutes from the delivery location at the time of the incident. Driver Nutall reported that he was unable to stop the truck and trailer due to apparent brake failure. The posted speed limit for the curve was 15 mph, as confirmed by photographs taken at the scene, which also documented tire marks showing the vehicle sliding off the road and rolling. Actions Taken at the Time of Discovery: The driver immediately notified dispatch and confirmed that he had sustained injuries to his head and lower back, but no other vehicles or individuals were involved. Local law enforcement was notified, and Officer Cliff Lance (Phone: 318-426-499) responded to the scene. The Louisiana State Police accident hotline was contacted at 10:19 AM; the call was taken by Amanda, who provided Incident #2121, which was initially given by Officer Lance. E3 Environmental was contacted to oversee environmental remediation and cleanup. They will be providing a cost estimate and handling hazardous materials containment. Nolan's Towing was notified to upright the truck and trailer and coordinate safe offloading of the contents. A secondary trailer, TX-18, operated by Driver Alan Reeves, was dispatched to receive the chemical transfer from the damaged trailer. Description of Package Failure: • The trailer was fully loaded with 45k of M2Guard-HSR105G at the time of the accident. Due to the trailer rolling into a ditch, there is potential for container displacement or compromise, though a full damage assessment was pending at time of report. While no visible punctures, cracks, or leaks were initially confirmed via driver call, an on-site inspection was ordered noticed some seepage from washout cap on dome lid area. Photographs taken at the scene showed clear evidence of road departure, slide marks, and the overturned position of the truck and trailer. • Any cracked, punctured, or ruptured drums will be identified by E3 Environmental and reported under separate documentation. Estimated Duration of Release: The exact duration of any material release is currently unknown pending E3's assessment. However, based on the time of the call (8:26 AM) and environmental response initiation (around 12:30 PM). Scene secured by law enforcement to prevent unauthorized access or ignition hazards. Environmental contractor (E3 Environmental) dispatched for cleanup, product containment, soi

item.title: Report E-2025060295
item.description:
Report E-2025060295

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-13
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 15000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On June 13, 2025, one (1) 3,000-pound tote of sulfuric acid was damaged by an explosion inside the tote and released approximately two hundred (200) gallons of product to the trailer interior and terminal yard. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the site. ES personnel deployed soda ash to the trailer interior, pavement and tires of nearby trailers. All sulfuric acid impacted material was collected and containerized into fifteen (15) 55-gallon drums and eleven (11) 35-gallon drums for future terminal disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025060169
item.description:
Report E-2025060169

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-09
  • City: ELMENDORF
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: MATRIX INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 30790
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On May 9, 2025. at 07:30 I've received a call from our driver. He noticed that there was a leak coming from a front end of the trailer and immediately called our office. The driver told me he was going to delivery at 15780 Alamo Jct. Elmendorf, TX 78112, he missed the left turn towards the Alamo Jct. (coming from the north on Richter Rd) and kept going south on Richter Rd and did a multipoint turn. That's where the load shifted and one of the IBCs got punctured by dunnage (wooden pallet, hole size 2 by 4) that shipper loaded up all the way in front of the trailer. A leak started and the driver called us immediately. If the shipper didn't load us with dunnage at the front of the trailer, the broken dunnage (pallet) wouldn't puncture the IBC even with the load shift that occurred. The duration of release was approximately 3hrs. No injuries or other damage were reported. I called Chemtrec (ER contact) and they advised me to call the Receiver (Univar) because they were just 20 yards down the road to have them try to contain the spill. On-site Univar Solutions personnel deployed granular absorbents and soda ash to contain and neutralize the release. Additionally, an 85-gallon drum was placed under the leaking tote to provide further containment until crews arrived. At approximately 8:29 AM CDT, a representative from Univar Solutions (US) retained Cura Emergency Services, L.C. (CES) to manage the environmental remediation of the site on their behalf. Based on the available information, the CES incident manager dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to assess and remediate the site as necessary.

item.title: Report E-2025050502
item.description:
Report E-2025050502

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-29
  • City: FAISON
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG LEASING, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 180000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC unit was traveling eastbound on I 40 near Faison, North Carolina. Another vehicle was improperly backing on the highway and was struck by the KAG Energy, LLC unit. Following impact, the KAG Energy, LLC unit went off the roadway and rolled over. Approximately 4700 gallons of fuel was released. A majority of the spilled gasoline was consumed in a fire that ignited following the accident. Eastern Environmental responded to the scene and is handling the remediation.

item.title: Report E-2025060264
item.description:
Report E-2025060264

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-25
  • City: FORT LAUDERDALE
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: JETBLUE AIRWAYS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: CALLER REPORTS (01) LITHIUM BATTERY RELEASED SMOKE INTO THE CABIN OF AN AIRCRAFT. THE SMOKE, POSSIBLY, CAME FROM A POWER BANK, IT IS UNKNOWN WHAT THE EXACT DEVICE WAS AS THE FIRE DEPARTMENT CONFISCATED THE ITEM. THE CAUSE OF THE RELEASE OF SMOKE IS UNKNOWN. THERE WAS NO DAMAGE TO THE ROW OR SEATS. THE INCIDENT OCCURRED ON A FLIGHT FROM FORT LAUDERDALE-HOLLYWOOD INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT TO PINDLING INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT IN NASSAU, BAHAMAS approximately 15 minutes prior to landing. A self-contained cell phone charger went into Thermal runaway and caught fire. The Crew immediately extinguished the fire and placed the charger in a water bath and secured it in the forward lavatory. Passengers deplaned normally through the JetBridge and ARFF team took possession of the charger. FLIGHT NUMBER 1593 1040 IS THE TIME THE INCIDENT OCCURRED IN THE BAHAMAS.

item.title: Report X-2025041279
item.description:
Report X-2025041279

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-28
  • City: GALESBURG
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 2
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 35070
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: MWCX 461433 was involved in a derailment in the Galesburg, IL yard on 3/28/25. MWCX 461433 sustained a puncture due to a coupler bypass. MWCX 461433 released approximately 100 pounds of product due to the puncture. One injury occurred and the train was eventually sent on its way. Hopper Car SIRX 525280 was discovered at a later time (2037) and location was about 40 miles from the original occurrence (City - Kewanee, County - Henry, IL). SIRX 525280 released approximately 25 pounds of product.

item.title: Report E-2025060121
item.description:
Report E-2025060121

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-11
  • City: BIG SPRING
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: GROENDYKE TRANSPORT INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 15543
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Spill while unloading from the external valve of 100 + gallons of sodium sulfide solutions onto gravel. Driver did not check the bleeder valve for obstruction in the valve before coupling to discharge line. Driver cap the discharge line to get a sample for the customer before coupling the discharge hose to the bleeder valve. Driver opened the internal and external valves to get a sample. When the driver opened the bleeder valve no product . Driver then opened the discharge cap causing the spill.
